OOC:

And we saw what a fraction of DNA gave Megatron... a velociraptor tha=
t could talk but couldn't transform. But naturally I expect the alien trans=
metal technology is available to everyone that wants to make a clone that c=
an transform ;)


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jeepers Creepers =

  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 7:19 PM
=
  Subject: Re: All Read: Important


  OOC:  I disagree, AGAIN.  Using the =
scanned DNA, the transformers take form(beast mode) of the animal that the =
DNA belongs too.  Thus, having a fraction of DNA.
    ----- Original Messag=
e ----- 
    From: Jonathan 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Wedn=
esday, January 30, 2002 4:24 PM
    Subject: Re: All Read: Important


    =
OOC:

    Transformers don't have DNA... they use DNA scans to select an al=
ternate form but beyond that they're still technological life forms....wasn=
't til BM that this fact was bastardized.

      ----- Original Message ---=
-- 
      From: Jeepers Creepers 
      To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
      S=
ent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 5:39 PM
      Subject: Re: All Read: Impor=
tant


      I disagree with that idea, because I intend on bring Skulletro=
n back, because Menasor kept some samples of his DNA.
        ----- Origina=
l Message ----- 
        From: Tankor 
        To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
=

        Subject: Re: All=
 Read: Important


        i got an idea once a char is killed they dont co=
me back 

          Jonathan <jhogan@...> wrote: 

          =
Anyway I was going to rant on about how a sequel wouldn't be all that
     =
     different from a restart but I figured why bother?

          When I h=
it the end of my long typed out rant I hit the problem. The real
          =
one. Another person posted that characters are not allowed to die
         =
 currently...he is utterly incorrect.

          The problem is the role-pl=
aying 101 aspect. People are given the
          responsibility to judge ho=
w much damage they take...however as we've seen
          some can't role-p=
lay their way out of a wet paper bag let alone responsibly
          judge =
how much damage their character takes. When a bot does get damaged
        =
  what typically happens here?

          Here's the list:

          1) Th=
e enemy bot suddenly becomes cockeyed unable to hit the broad side of a
   =
       barn even if he was a g1 and standing over it.

          2) The bot=
 never gives chase to his prey. It always lets the long time
          char=
acter slip away.

          3) A short stay (a few hours usually) in the CR=
 chamber and any damage is
          completely gone.

          4) The cha=
racter "dies" but faked his death coming back as an enemy
          infiltr=
ator.

          5) Character "dies" but an evil clone appears which after =
various meeting
          with colleagues or "loved ones" turns good again.=
 Personality reverts to
          pre-evil clone.

          6) Character "=
dies" but is reborn as a more powerful offspring. Personality
          is =
hardly different.

          7) Character "dies" but the players 6 other ch=
aracters cart it's blasted
          carcass back to a lab where they resur=
rect him.

          8) Character "dies" replace with new bot same personal=
ity...eventually
          people will forget you died and you can go back =
to your old form.

          Since most will never let their "favorite" cha=
racter(s) die, I mean truly
          die, never come back like, there's re=
ally very little new plotlines you can
          do with them without repea=
ting rehashed already done ones. Take for example
          the geotrons pl=
aning to attack the new cat faction....both factions will
          survive=
, I doubt either player who controls the majority of bots in either
       =
   faction is gonna let their characters get anywhere near killed.

       =
   And what's to stop this from happening if a restart/sequel DOES occur? T=
he
          role-playing by some will still stink, characters will still b=
e incapable of
          dying and given another year or so all plotlines f=
or THAT game will be
          starting to repeat. While I still do believe=
 a restart/sequel is in order I
          think the role-playing problem ne=
eds addressing first to stop a repeat of
          what's happening to NBW.=




          ----- Original Message -----
          From: "x_rauq_x" <x_ra=
uq_x@...>

          Sent: Sund=
ay, January 20, 2002 5:57 AM
          Subject: All Read: Important

ong, and the

already. It seems to
          > me that we are almost delaying the end of =
the rpg. If you've created
          > one storyline that you like, is it n=
ot fair to say that you can
          > create another better one?
        =

          > The idea of creating a sequel to the rpg is one that I woul=
d agree
          > with. That would require several things to happen:
    =
      > 1) Changing the name of the RPG.
          > 2) Appropriate changes=
 to the website.
          > 3) A means to store all of everyone's previous=
 characters (don't
          > know about everyone else, but I don't want t=
o lose the bio's of all
          > my characters).
          > 4) New stor=
y (i have an idea, not necessarily for the story, but for
          > how w=
e could create the story).
          > 5) A catalyst to start us all off (t=
he story should provide that).
          > 6) Implementation of new rules, =
some of which have been, and are
          > being, discussed in the login =
messageboard.
          > 7) other stuff that could be written if I wasn't =
so tired.
          >
          > All in all, since there are more people v=
oting anti-restart that I'd
          > anticpated, I'll ask everyone a per=
haps fate deciding question:
          >
          > Would it be favourable=
 to have a sequel instead of a restart?
          >
          >
